p: Dried mealworm larvae contain high amounts of crude protein (CP, 46% to 52%) and fat (25% to 35%) which contain abundant essential fatty acids with superior oxidative stability [ 11]. Fresh larvae contain about 60% water. They have low Ca content and very low Ca:P ratio as other insects. Their Ca is slightly less available than Ca from oyster shells [ 12]. Exclusive feeding of mealworms can lead to Ca deficiency and symptomatic metabolic bone disease [ 12] because of their low Ca content and low Ca:P ratio. Studies on the feed value of the mealworm larvae have been done in poultry [ 4, 13â€“ 17] and swine [ 18, 19], but the results of the study were not enough.
